result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Nmi Green #437039 Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melvin Nmi Green Jr. appeared by video, in custody at Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution. Statements by ADA Lippert. State is unsure as to why the defendant is not eligible for the programs. Statements from defendant. Court explained findings from research of this case. Court found the defendant ineligible for the substance abuse program. The motion is denied. Defendant made further argument. 9:25 AM

records.addlTxt: 10:09 AM Attorney Jordan Lippert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Melvin Green Jr. appeared in court by video in custody from Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution. Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared in court by video for the defendant. Right to appear in person, defendant waived, agreed to proceed via video. Sentencing recommendations argued. Statement by defendant. Count 2 - Court sentenced defendant to 36 months prison, 18 months initial confinement/18 months extended supervision concurrent to count 3, consecutive to any other sentencing currently serving. Count 3 - Court sentenced defendant to 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement/3 years extended supervision concurrent to count 2, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 0 credit. 10:34 AM

Associated with Charge #1
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Melvin Nmi Green in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1,2,3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence on count one  -  2 1/2 yr. prison, consisting of 1 yr. confinement, 1 1/2 years extended supervision. Conds: $518 costs, submit DNA sample, Defendant is eligible for Challenge Academy and Substance Abuse program. On cts. 2&3 concurrent with each other, 5 years probation, but consecutive to count one extended supervision, $268 & $268 costs.  Ct. 4 read in and dismissed. Court granted 44 days jail credit on count one.

Defendant Melvin Nmi Green in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.
